learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, you can work as a software developer in a large team. You understand the structure and technical and non-technical challenges of software development projects, and you can apply Scrum framework in a software project. Furthermore you learn to apply the development tools and implementation technologies used in the chosen project. In some of the project teams you learn to work in an international work environment in English.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course, you can work as a software developer in a large team. You understand the structure and technical and non-technical challenges of software development projects, and you can apply Scrum framework in a software project. Furthermore you learn to apply the development tools and implementation technologies used in the chosen project. In some of the project teams you learn to work in an international work environment in English.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course, you can work as a software developer in a large team. You understand the structure and technical and non-technical challenges of software development projects, and you can apply Scrum framework in a software project. Furthermore you learn to apply the development tools and implementation technologies used in the chosen project. In some of the project teams you learn to work in an international work environment in English.

content.fi: The course consists of a software development project which will be done for a real client from industry or academia. The projects use the Scrum framework which is taught before the project starts. The activities include project management, requirements specification, design, coding, quality assurance, and system delivery. Students from the CS-E4910 Software Project 3 course work as Scrum Masters in the project teams.

learningOutcomes.fi: The idea of the course is to get to know the idea of the Semantic Web, the technologies and its possible applications and learn how to use the programming tools of the area in practice.
learningOutcomes.sv: The idea of the course is to get to know the idea of the Semantic Web, the technologies and its possible applications and learn how to use the programming tools of the area in practice.
learningOutcomes.en: The idea of the course is to get to know the idea of the Semantic Web, the technologies and its possible applications and learn how to use the programming tools of the area in practice.

content.fi: The core content of the course consists of Semantic Web technologies and standards such as Resource Description Framework (RDF) and Web Ontology Language (OWL). Rule systems, ontology techniques and Semantic Web tools and applications will also be covered. The theoretical part of the course will be complemented by exercise work.

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Fundamentals of algorithm design and analysis recommended. Mathematics studies in Bachelor's degree.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course will deepen your knowledge and skills in algorithm design. You will become familiar with a number of advanced design principles and tradeoffs between objectives and computational resources.
learningOutcomes.sv: This course will deepen your knowledge and skills in algorithm design. You will become familiar with a number of advanced design principles and tradeoffs between objectives and computational resources.
learningOutcomes.en: This course will deepen your knowledge and skills in algorithm design. You will become familiar with a number of advanced design principles and tradeoffs between objectives and computational resources.

content.fi: Advanced algorithm design techniques such as randomization, approximation, parameterisation, and algebrisation. Examples of contemporary advanced algorithms and supporting data structures. Tradeoffs between objectives and computational resources. The course consists of a fixed core part and a varying part covering topics of current interest.

The course consists of a fixed core part and a varying part covering topics of current interest.

The course consists of a fixed core part and a varying part covering topics of current interest.

workload.en: Lectures and workshops 20h, reading study materials 10h, writing and reviewing assignments or an exam 30h, group work 75h.

prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: No prerequisites.Recommended prerequisites: No prerequisites.
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: No prerequisites.Recommended prerequisites: No prerequisites.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After this course, you know the basic methods for user research. You are comfortable with reading academic articles and can write and reference
an academic essay properly. You can list and describe different methods used in the early stages of
User-Centered Design process. You can analytically select appropriate method for a given user research problem. You know how to apply common user research methods in a simple field study. You can find and analyze user data, and produce relevant new information. You can concisely present research results and user knowledge to an audience.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After this course, you know the basic methods for user research.
You are comfortable with reading academic articles and can write and referencean academic essay properly.
You can list and describe different methods used in the early stages of User-Centered Design process.
You can analytically select appropriate method for a given user research problem.
You know how to apply common user research methods in a simple field study.
You can find and analyze user data, and produce relevant new information.
You can concisely present research results and user knowledge to an audience.
learningOutcomes.en:
After this course, you know the basic methods for user research.
You are comfortable with reading academic articles and can write and referencean academic essay properly.
You can list and describe different methods used in the early stages of User-Centered Design process.
You can analytically select appropriate method for a given user research problem.
You know how to apply common user research methods in a simple field study.
You can find and analyze user data, and produce relevant new information.
You can concisely present research results and user knowledge to an audience.

content.fi: The course introduces the most common user research methods for early stage product and service design, and provides tools to analyze and visualize the gathered data to fuel product and service design.
content.sv: The course introduces the most common user research methods for early stage product and service design, and provides tools to analyze and visualize the gathered data to fuel product and service design.
content.en: The course introduces the most common user research methods for early stage product and service design, and provides tools to analyze and visualize the gathered data to fuel product and service design.

learningOutcomes.fi: You learn to act as a Scrum Master in a software project and to prepare and lead the various Scrum events such as plannings, reviews and retrospectives. You learn how to adopt and adapt Scrum in a realistic project, and to reflect its usage. You learn to plan, organize and conduct collaboration with your student team, real customer, and an agile Coach.

learningOutcomes.fi: After this course, you are able to plan your studies in Software and Service Engineering (SSE) major; analyze what you have learned from the courses and work experience so far; and create a learning portfolio. You are able to recognize your professional identity and network with potential employers and other SSE students. In addition, you are able to plan ahead and prepare for your master's thesis.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After taking this course, you are able to
  • analyze the architecturally significant requirements and scenarios based on the stakeholder concerns for an open-ended, complex problem,
  • design a high-level architecture that tries to address the architecturally significant requirements and scenarios; the design is created iteratively and as team work,
  • model and document the design and design decisions using multiple views and viewpoints and in a consistent fashion,
  • evaluate whether the high-level architecture design addresses the scenarios, and
  • analyze and present all aforementioned orally.

  • model and document the design and design decisions using multiple views and viewpoints and in a consistent fashion,
  • evaluate whether the high-level architecture design addresses the scenarios, and
  • analyze and present all aforementioned orally.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After taking this course, you are able to
  • define the essential concepts of testing and software quality,
  • understand the objectives of software testing and the significance of testing and quality assurance as part of software engineering,
  • know different ways of organizing testing, common testing techniques as well as other quality practices,
  • select and apply appropriate quality practices in different situations and understand the strengths and weaknesses of the practices, and
  • understand the purposes that testing tools and test automation can be used for, and the typical challenges of test automation.

  • select and apply appropriate quality practices in different situations and understand the strengths and weaknesses of the practices, and
  • understand the purposes that testing tools and test automation can be used for, and the typical challenges of test automation.

content.fi: Basics of software testing and quality assurance, concepts, testing techniques and reviews. Test planning, management and tools. The role of testing in quality assurance and quality assurance as part of the software process.

learningOutcomes.fi: At this course, the students learn about user interface and interaction design. After completing the course, students are able to develop an interactive user interface that can be used, for instance, in usability testing or other explorations with users. Students get to know the user-centred principles, and learn how to apply guidelines, patterns, and style guides in the design and implementation of user interfaces.

learningOutcomes.fi: Contents vary by year. A solid understanding of a particular subfield of computer graphics and its state of the art, and ability to put the understanding to practice through programming.
learningOutcomes.sv: Contents vary by year. A solid understanding of a particular subfield of computer graphics and its state of the art, and ability to put the understanding to practice through programming.
learningOutcomes.en: Contents vary by year. A solid understanding of a particular subfield of computer graphics and its state of the art, and ability to put the understanding to practice through programming.

content.fi: Contents may vary by year, but always form a deeper dive into the theory, algorithms, and their practical implementation of a particular subfield of computer graphics. In the past few years, the topic has been was physically based rendering, both its theory and numerical methods for generating realistic pictures.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Differential and integral calculus, basics of probability and statistics, basics of programming (R or Python). Recommended: matrix algebra.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student can explain the central concepts in Bayesian statistics, and name steps of the Bayesian modeling process. The student can recognize usages for common (i.e. those presented during the course) statistical models, and formulate the models in these situations. The student can compare the most popular Bayesian simulation methods, and implement them. The student can use analytic and simulation based methods for learning the parameters of a given model. The student can estimate the fit of a model to data and compare models.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course, the student can explain the central concepts in Bayesian statistics, and name steps of the Bayesian modeling process. The student can recognize usages for common (i.e. those presented during the course) statistical models, and formulate the models in these situations. The student can compare the most popular Bayesian simulation methods, and implement them. The student can use analytic and simulation based methods for learning the parameters of a given model. The student can estimate the fit of a model to data and compare models.

The student can recognize usages for common (i.e. those presented during the course) statistical models, and formulate the models in these situations. The student can estimate the fit of a model to data and compare models.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin jälkeen osaat hahmottaa, miten mediasisältöjä (esim. teksti, kuva, ääni ja video) voidaan julkaista ja tuottaa verkkoon web-teknologioiden ja digitaalisen median työkalujen avulla. Kurssilla opituilla taidoilla pystyt rakentamaan ja julkaisemaan teknisesti yksinkertaisia verkkosivuja ja verkkoapplikaatioita. Osaat suunnitella ja rakentaa yksinkertaisia sisällöllisiä kokonaisuuksia ja ymmärrät vuorovaikutuksen merkityksen osana kokonaisuutta.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avklarad kurs uppfattar du hur medieinnehåll (t.ex. text, bilder, ljud och video) kan publiceras och produceras på nätet med hjälp av webbteknologier och digitala medieverktyg. Med de färdigheter du lär dig på kursen kommer du att kunna bygga och publicera tekniskt enkla webbplatser och onlineapplikationer. Du kan planera och bygga upp enkla innehållsliga helheter och förstår interaktionens betydelse som en del av helheten.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course you will be able to perceive how media content (e.g., text, graphics, audio, and video) can be published and produced on the Web using web technologies and digital media tools. With the skills you learn on the course, you will be able to build and publish technically simple websites and online applications. You will be able to design and develop simple, content-oriented websites as well as understand the significance of interaction as part of the whole.

content.fi: Kurssi keskittyy asiakaspään web-teknologioiden (esim. HTML, CSS ja JavaScript) sekä verkkojulkaisemista tukevien digitaalisen median työkalujen (esim. kuvankäsittely- ja videoeditointiohjelmistot) hallintaan. Kurssin aihealueisiin perehdytään sekä teoriassa (luennot) että käytännössä (luennot, harjoitustyöt ja projektityö). Kurssilla sivutaan teknisten aiheiden lisäksi vuorovaikutuksen suunnittelua.
content.sv: Kursen fokuserar sig på behärskning av klientsidans webbteknologier (t.ex. HTML, CSS och JavaScript) samt digitala medieverktyg (t.ex. bildbehandlings- och videoediteringsprogram) som stöder nätpublicering. Kursens teman gås igenom både i teorin (föreläsningar) och praktiken (föreläsningar, övningsarbeten och projektarbete). Kursen tangerar utöver tekniska teman också interaktionsdesign.
content.en: The course focuses on mastering client-side web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, and JavaScript) as well as digital media tools (e.g., graphics and video editing software) that support web publishing. The course topics are covered both in theory (lectures) and practice (lectures, exercises, and project work). In addition to technical topics, the course touches on interaction design.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssilla annettava opetus koostuu luennoista ja ohjatuista harjoituksista. Kurssi arvostellaan harjoitustöiden ja lopputyönä toteutettavan palvelun konseptidemon perusteella. Kiitettävä suoritus edellyttää itsenäistä työskentelyä luentojen ja ohjattujen harjoitusten ulkopuolella. Harjoitustöiden ja projektityön pisteytyksessä huomioidaan idea sekä sen tekninen ja visuaalinen toteutus.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursens undervisning består av föreläsningarna och de handledda övningarna. Kursen värderas enligt övningarna och slutarbetet som förverkligas som ett koncept och demonstration av en social medietjänst. En berömlig prestation förutsätter självständigt arbete utöver föreläsningarna och de handledda övningarna. Poängsättningen av övningarna och projektarbetet tar hänsyn till idén samt det tekniska och visuella förverkligandet.
assesmentMethods.en: The course teaching consists of lectures and guided exercises. The grading is based on the exercises and project  work, which is a concept and demonstration of a social media service. An excellent grade requires self-study outside the lectures and guided exercises. The evaluation of the exercises and project work takes into account both the idea as well as its technical and visual implementation.

additionalInformation.fi: Opetuskieli: suomi Opetusperiodi: 2024-2025 Kevät III - V  2025-2026 Kevät III - V Ilmoittautuminen: Kurssille otetaan enintään 70 opiskelijaa. Kurssille valitaan opiskelijat seuraavassa järjestyksessä 1) informaatioverkostojen pääaineopiskelijat, 2) Aallon muut opiskelijat.
additionalInformation.sv: Undervisningsspråket: finska Undervisningsperiod: 2024-2025 Vår III - V  2025-2026 Vår III - V Anmälan: Högst 70 studerande antas till kursen. Deltagare väljs till kursen i följande ordning 1) huvudämnestuderande från Informationsnätverk, 2) övriga studerande vid Aalto-universitetet.

learningOutcomes.fi: The course provides students with basic knowledge of philosophical and applied aesthetics with a specific focus on new and emerging technologies. The core concepts presented during the course (e.g. sense perception, aesthetic judgment/experience/engagement, value, intention, interpretation) enable the students to contextualize and participate in contemporary discussions regarding the aesthetic dimensions of human-world and human-technology relations. Students gain access to a theoretical framework that will enhance their critical thinking, argumentation skills, as well as aesthetic sensibility.

Students gain access to a theoretical framework that will enhance their critical thinking, argumentation skills, as well as aesthetic sensibility.

Students gain access to a theoretical framework that will enhance their critical thinking, argumentation skills, as well as aesthetic sensibility.

content.fi: Course presents a selection of ideas and concepts in contemporary aesthetic thinking through a wide selection of real-life examples that combine technology, design, and art. The weekly contact teaching sessions consist of lectures, small group discussions, and planning and executing a final group task.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students will learn how to search scientific/technical information and effectively communicate their findings to the public in the form of a written report and a short presentation. In addition, they will learn how to work as part of a group that plans, schedules, executes, and documents a small web development project.
learningOutcomes.sv: Students will learn how to search scientific/technical information and effectively communicate their findings to the public in the form of a written report and a short presentation. In addition, they will learn how to work as part of a group that plans, schedules, executes, and documents a small web development project.

In addition, they will learn how to work as part of a group that plans, schedules, executes, and documents a small web development project.

content.fi: The course deals with emerging/experimental web technologies. The actual topics addressed vary from year to year. In previous years, both the presentation and project work are combined together as a single project, which is done in groups of 3-4 students. The topics include most important HTML5 technologies, such as Canvas, WebGL, WebSockets, Web Workers, Geolocation, local storage, and CORS.

name.fi: Mathematical Methods for Network Science D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Mathematical Methods for Network Science D, Föreläsning
name.en: Mathematical Methods for Network Science D, Lecture

workload.fi: The course has lectures and two exercise sessions weekly. One of the weekly exercise sessions has mandatory participance. The workload of 135 hours (=5 ECTS) is divided into 24 hours of contact studies in exercise sessions, 12 hours of lectures, and 99 hours of self-study (including exercises, reading the course book, and reviewing lecture materials) and reflection.
workload.sv: The course has lectures and two exercise sessions weekly. One of the weekly exercise sessions has mandatory participance. The workload of 135 hours (=5 ECTS) is divided into 24 hours of contact studies in exercise sessions, 12 hours of lectures, and 99 hours of self-study (including exercises, reading the course book, and reviewing lecture materials) and reflection.

The workload of 135 hours (=5 ECTS) is divided into 24 hours of contact studies in exercise sessions, 12 hours of lectures, and 99 hours of self-study (including exercises, reading the course book, and reviewing lecture materials) and reflection.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course will provide students an overview on mathematical topics and tools in network science. The students will develop skills in doing pen-and-paper calculations and an understanding of analytical methods that are common in network science.
learningOutcomes.sv: This course will provide students an overview on mathematical topics and tools in network science. The students will develop skills in doing pen-and-paper calculations and an understanding of analytical methods that are common in network science.
learningOutcomes.en: This course will provide students an overview on mathematical topics and tools in network science. The students will develop skills in doing pen-and-paper calculations and an understanding of analytical methods that are common in network science.

content.fi: Mathematical methods and their use in networks science. Topics are mostly related to large random graphs and include  common approximations and assumptions  in network science, network models,  component size distributions, percolation,  branching processes, excess degree distributions, probability generating functions, master  equations, rate equations, growing network models, processes on networks, exponential  random graphs, and stochastic block  models. The project can be on a recent research topic.
content.sv: Mathematical methods and their use in networks science. The project can be on a recent research topic.
content.en: Mathematical methods and their use in networks science. Topics are mostly related to large random graphs and include  common approximations and assumptions  in network science, network models,  component size distributions, percolation,  branching processes, excess degree distributions, probability generating functions, master  equations, rate equations, growing network models, processes on networks, exponential  random graphs, and stochastic block  models. The project can be on a recent research topic.

learningOutcomes.fi: The student will learn the principles of analysing nonlinear and chaotic dynamical systems using mathematics, and diagrammatic and numerical methods. Basic understanding of fundamental concepts in chaotic systems such as strange attractors will be obtained.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Basics of propositional logic covered, for instance, in the course CS-E4800 Artificial Intelligence. Programming skills in some procedural language such as Python, Java, Scala or C++. Fundamental data structures and algorithms, e.g., the CS-A1140 Data Structures and Algorithms course. Basics on discrete mathematics.

learningOutcomes.fi: Once you have completed the course you have familiarized yourself with the art of declarative programming with constraint solvers, where the goal is to specify what is to be computed rather than how the actual computation is to take place. You will have an in-depth understanding of central logical representations deployed in the paradigm. Moreover, you are aware of the fundamental algorithmic ideas needed to implement constraint solver tools in practice. You will have a good understanding of some of the main applications of declarative and model-based solution methods, including analysis of discrete systems by state-space search and model-checking. The hands-on exercises ensure that you will gain practical modeling skills and substantial familiarity with application problems and their main characteristics.

Moreover, you are aware of the fundamental algorithmic ideas needed to implement constraint solver tools in practice. You will have a good understanding of some of the main applications of declarative and model-based solution methods, including analysis of discrete systems by state-space search and model-checking. The hands-on exercises ensure that you will gain practical modeling skills and substantial familiarity with application problems and their main characteristics.

Moreover, you are aware of the fundamental algorithmic ideas needed to implement constraint solver tools in practice. The hands-on exercises ensure that you will gain practical modeling skills and substantial familiarity with application problems and their main characteristics.

content.fi:
The course covers selected mainstream approaches to declarative programming with constraint solvers, such as Boolean satisfiability (SAT), constraint satisfaction problems (CSP) and satisfiability modulo theories (SMT), as well as some of their most important applications in computer-aided verification and validation of software and hardware systems.
In addition to some of the algorithmic technologies for constraint programming, the course acts as an introduction to declarative and model-based solution of hard computational problems. Application problems are solved by first representing the problem declaratively (as opposed to procedurally) in a high-level modeling language, and then finding one or more solutions by using a general-purpose solver for the high-level modeling language. The declarative models have a semantics separate from the solver algorithms, and the models can be used for multiple purposes and with different types of solver technologies. For example, the same model could be used for control and decision-making, diagnosis, and monitoring.
Specific contents are given on the MyCourses page of the course instance.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, you can select methods for collaborative evaluation of usability and user experience. You are able to design and carry out an evaluation of interactive systems in different contexts. You know how to communicate your results to various stakeholders in order to impact the further development of the system or service.

content.fi: The course introduces several methods for collaborative evaluation of interactive systems. The methods for evaluation of usability and user experience are applied in project assignments conducted in cooperation with cases from industry, public sector, and academia. The findings from the assignments are used to further the development of the evaluated interactive system or service.

learningOutcomes.fi: Students learn how to do a market and business environment analysis for internationalizing technology based businesses, how to analyze and adjust product and service offerings according to targeted markets and how to make a  market entry plan leveraging the opportunities of the geographical and increasingly digital business environments.
learningOutcomes.sv: Students learn how to do a market and business environment analysis for internationalizing technology based businesses, how to analyze and adjust product and service offerings according to targeted markets and how to make a  market entry plan leveraging the opportunities of the geographical and increasingly digital business environments.

content.fi: Theory base of a firm and ecosystem level growth process, internationalization models and processes. The course project work is done in small entrepreneurial teams and involves creating analyses of markets and competitive environments, optimizing product and service based offerings, and developing a real go-to-market plan for real-life operating firms. At the end of the course each team presents results to the class as well as to a panel including teaching personnel, company representatives and domain experts.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Automata and formal languages. Deterministic and nondeterministic Turing machines. Decidable and undecidable problems. Basics of discrete mathematics.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Automata and formal languages. Deterministic and nondeterministic Turing machines. Decidable and undecidable problems. Basics of discrete mathematics.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Automata and formal languages. Deterministic and nondeterministic Turing machines. Decidable and undecidable problems. Basics of discrete mathematics.

learningOutcomes.fi: Once you have taken the course, you master the central concepts of computational complexity theory and are able to use these concepts to analyse the complexity of computational problems. You can formulate a concrete real-world computational task as a formal computational problem and formally reason about its computational complexity in comparison with well-known problems and complexity classes. You can use reductions and other complexity-theoretic concepts to identify which algorithmic tools such as randomisation, approximation, parameterisation and parallelism can and cannot help with the efficient solution of a given problem.
learningOutcomes.sv: Once you have taken the course, you master the central concepts of computational complexity theory and are able to use these concepts to analyse the complexity of computational problems. You can formulate a concrete real-world computational task as a formal computational problem and formally reason about its computational complexity in comparison with well-known problems and complexity classes. You can use reductions and other complexity-theoretic concepts to identify which algorithmic tools such as randomisation, approximation, parameterisation and parallelism can and cannot help with the efficient solution of a given problem.
learningOutcomes.en: Once you have taken the course, you master the central concepts of computational complexity theory and are able to use these concepts to analyse the complexity of computational problems. You can formulate a concrete real-world computational task as a formal computational problem and formally reason about its computational complexity in comparison with well-known problems and complexity classes. You can use reductions and other complexity-theoretic concepts to identify which algorithmic tools such as randomisation, approximation, parameterisation and parallelism can and cannot help with the efficient solution of a given problem.

content.fi: Basic concepts of complexity theory: models of computation, complexity measures including time and space, reductions, complexity classes and completeness. Complexity classes: P, NP and coNP; PSPACE, LOGSPACE, EXPTIME. Advanced topics such as the polynomial hierarchy, approximation, randomised computation, circuits and parallel computation, fine-grained complexity, and relativisations.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course you know the most important mathematical models of computation and their characteristics. You can model computation using finite automata and describe simple syntactic patterns with regular expressions and context-free grammars. You understand the possibilities and limitations of the computation models and description formalisms studied during the course, and know their relationships. You understand how the Turing machine model characterises everything that can be computed with a computer program, and that there are well-defined problems that cannot be solved by any program.

name.fi: Introduction to Digital Business and Venturing D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Introduction to Digital Business and Venturing D, Föreläsning
name.en: Introduction to Digital Business and Venturing D, Lecture

workload.fi: This is a 3 ECTS course (81 hours). The expected student work hours are as follows: Lectures: 12 h, individual studying and work: 22 h, and course assignments 47 h. Assignments consist of working both individually and in small teams. Individual work consists of preparing for lectures and parts of the assignments.

prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: NoneRecommended prerequisites: None
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: NoneRecommended prerequisites: None

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course you:
  • know the basic characteristics of digital business and entrepreneurship in the digital age
  • are aware of phenomena and key drivers related to digitalization and transformation of business organizations, industries and societies
  • understand the role and importance of new and growing businesses to national economies
  • have general understanding of the process and roles involved in developing an idea and starting up a new technology-based company
  • are familiar with exploring customers and markets, analyzing technology and service based business models and factors having effect on their performance
  • are familiar with value creation and capture mechanisms, intellectual properties and related strategies
  • are aware of different approaches in modelling a business logic for a venture and can apply at least one of them to real world business cases
  • understand the role, content and recognize different types of a business-level strategy
  • are aware of the ethical and sustainable viewpoints in business having readiness for critical thinking and assessment

content.fi:
Combination of theory and expert lectures, selected readings and online contents, and real world business case assignments from the following themes:
  • Digital and various high-tech markets and industries
  • Creative destruction, disruption, digitalization, convergence, automation, consumerization, commoditization, servitization, digital transformation; ecosystems, and platforms
  • Mobility, cloud (computing), social (media), information (analytics), big data, mydata, machine learning, artificial intelligence, data mining, blockchain etc.
  • Markets and industries, customer segmentation, business organization, entrepreneur, entrepreneurship process, venturing, leadership, management, business processes, operations, value creation logic and strategy
  • Opportunity identification, idea development, business model analysis and design, new venture creation
  • Ethical and sustainability viewpoints in business, case digital environment

prerequisites.fi: TU-C1011 Ryhmätoiminta ja organisointi, TU-C3022 Organizing of Business, TU-E3041 Leadership and Change Management

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course a student will be able to 1) explain a concept of paradigm and different constructivist views on social reality, and contemporary concepts of leadership, 2) recognize contextual and relational nature of human agency, 3) practice dialogic and constructive communication in various social settings (pair, small group, large group), 4) review critically leadership related social concepts, rhetoric, and practices, 5) reflect critically on his/her personal experiences, relational practices, meaning making, and thinking on leadership, and 6) understand how leadership related skills and practices can be learned and developed both individually and collectively
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course a student will be able to 1) explain a concept of paradigm and different constructivist views on social reality, and contemporary concepts of leadership, 2) recognize contextual and relational nature of human agency, 3) practice dialogic and constructive communication in various social settings (pair, small group, large group), 4) review critically leadership related social concepts, rhetoric, and practices, 5) reflect critically on his/her personal experiences, relational practices, meaning making, and thinking on leadership, and 6) understand how leadership related skills and practices can be learned and developed both individually and collectively
learningOutcomes.en: After the course a student will be able to 1) explain a concept of paradigm and different constructivist views on social reality, and contemporary concepts of leadership, 2) recognize contextual and relational nature of human agency, 3) practice dialogic and constructive communication in various social settings (pair, small group, large group), 4) review critically leadership related social concepts, rhetoric, and practices, 5) reflect critically on his/her personal experiences, relational practices, meaning making, and thinking on leadership, and 6) understand how leadership related skills and practices can be learned and developed both individually and collectively

content.fi: The course familiarizes the students with constructive and relational leadership theories and frameworks. Different approaches to leadership are critically examined by the students both separately through their own thinking and collectively in group discussions. These frameworks and their different aspects are utilized in analyzing and interpreting personal leadership experiences, and generic leadership related phenomena and practices. The course emphasizes the student's personal development through relational discourse, appreciative argumentation, and reflection. Towards the end of the course the students are expected to have constructed a personalized view on leadership and elaborated a preliminary plan of their personal development as a leader.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing the course, students 
* can model federated learning (FL) applications using graphs
* are familiar with total variation (TV) minimization as a flexible design principle for FL algorithms
* can design federated learning algorithms by applying optimizatoin methods to TV minimization
* can analyze computational and statistical properties of FL algorithms
learningOutcomes.sv:
After completing the course, students 
* can model federated learning (FL) applications using graphs
* are familiar with total variation (TV) minimization as a flexible design principle for FL algorithms
* can design federated learning algorithms by applying optimizatoin methods to TV minimization
* can analyze computational and statistical properties of FL algorithms
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, students 
* can model federated learning (FL) applications using graphs
* are familiar with total variation (TV) minimization as a flexible design principle for FL algorithms
* can design federated learning algorithms by applying optimizatoin methods to TV minimization
* can analyze computational and statistical properties of FL algorithms

content.fi:
* machine learning basics: data, model, loss, regularization, multi-task learning, semi-supervised learning, transfer learning
* network basics: graphs and their matrices, community/cluster structure  
* TV minimization as a flexible design principle for FL
* main flavors of FL (centralized, clustered, personalized) as special cases of TV minimization
* distributed optimization: models for distributed computation, fixed-point iterations, gradient-based methods
content.sv:

* network basics: graphs and their matrices, community/cluster structure  
* TV minimization as a flexible design principle for FL
* main flavors of FL (centralized, clustered, personalized) as special cases of TV minimization
* distributed optimization: models for distributed computation, fixed-point iterations, gradient-based methods

* machine learning basics: data, model, loss, regularization, multi-task learning, semi-supervised learning, transfer learning

* main flavors of FL (centralized, clustered, personalized) as special cases of TV minimization
* distributed optimization: models for distributed computation, fixed-point iterations, gradient-based methods

prerequisites.fi: CS-A1110 Ohjelmointi 1 tai CS-A1111 Ohjelmoinnin peruskurssi Y1.
prerequisites.sv: CS-A1110 Programmering 1 eller CS-A1111 Grundkurs i programmering Y1.
prerequisites.en: CS-A1110 Programming 1 or CS-A1111 Basic Course in Programming Y1.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuasi ymmärrät käsitemallinnuksen merkityksen tiedonhallinnassa ja tunnet yleisimmin käytetyt tietokantojen mallinnus- ja kyselykielet. Osaat suunnitella yksinkertaisia tietokantoja ja tehdä niihin kyselyitä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avklarad kurs förstår du begreppsmodelleringens betydelse i datahanteringoch kan de vanligaste modellerings- och frågespråken för databaser. Du kan planera enkla databaser och göra förfrågningar i dem.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course you understand the role of conceptual modeling in managing data, and know the commonly used database modeling and querying languages. You can design simple databases and write queries.

literature.en: Ullman, Widom: A First Course in Database Systems, Third Edition or New International Edition. Pearson.
literature.fi: Ullman, Widom: A First Course in Database Systems, Third Edition or New International Edition. Pearson.
literature.sv: Ullman, Widom: A First Course in Database Systems, Third Edition or New International Edition. Pearson.

content.fi: Kurssilla käsitellään tiedonhallinnan peruskäsitteitä ja -menetelmiä. Relaatioalgebra, relaatiotietokannat, SQL-kielen käyttö tietokannan määrittelyssä ja käsittelyssä, UML-suunnittelumenetelmä, taulujen normalisointi.
content.sv: Inom kursen granskas grundbegrepp samt metoder för databashantering. I första hand genomgås planering och implementering av databaser med hjälp av den sk. relationsmodellen.
content.en: Basic concepts and methods in database systems. Relational databases: relational algebra, UML-design, normalization and SQL.

assesmentMethods.fi: Tentti ja pakollinen harjoitustyö. Mahdollisuus saada lisäpisteitä harjoitustehtävistä.
assesmentMethods.sv: Tentamen samt ett obligatoriskt övningsarbete. Räkneövningarna ger möjlighet till tilläggspoäng.
assesmentMethods.en: Final examination and an compulsory assignment. Possibility to get extra credits from exercises.

additionalInformation.fi: Kurssi on mahdollista suorittaa englanniksi. Luennot ovat suomeksi, mutta niiden sijaan voi itseopiskella vastaavat asiat lukemalla englanninkielistä oppikirjaa. Kurssin suuren osallistujamäärän vuoksi, ilmoittautuminen kaikkiin tentteihin, mukaan lukien kurssin ensimmäinen tentti (KT = kurssitentti) on pakollista.Opetusperiodi: 2020-2021 Kevät III-V2021-2022 Kevät III-VKurssin kotisivu: https://mycourses.aalto.fi/course/search.php?search=CS-A1150Ilmoittautuminen: Lukuvuonna 2021-2022 opetukseen ilmoittaudutaan WebOodin sijaan Sisussa (sisu.aalto.fi).
additionalInformation.sv: Kursen kan på begärän avläggas på engelska. På grund av det stora antalet deltagare i kursen, anmälan till alla tentamina, inklusive den första tentamen på kursen (KT = kurstentamen) är obligatorisk.Undervisningsperiod: 2020-2021 Vår III-V2021-2022 Vår III-VKursens webbplats: https://mycourses.aalto.fi/course/search.php?search=CS-A1150Anmälning: Anmälan till undervisningen för läsåret 2021-2022 sker i Sisu, inte i WebOodi.
additionalInformation.en: It is possible to complete the course in English by reading the English text book instead of attending the Finnish lectures. learningOutcomes.fi: This course is intended to be taken after CS-E5740 Complex Networks; it will deepen the students knowledge on network analysis techniques and dealing with empirical network data, including network visualization, Python programming, and statistical analysis. Students will also learn how to conduct team research and how to present their findings to their peers.

prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites:

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija osaa:
  • Selittää muiden ihmisten vaikutusta ihmisen käyttäytymiseen
  • Analysoida ryhmien ja organisaatioiden toimintaa
  • Huomioida asenteita ja ihmisten ajattelua suunnittelussa
  • Soveltaa sosiaalipsykologiaa suunnitellessaan teknisiä ratkaisuja
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen kan studeranden:
· Förklara andra människors påverkan på mänskligt beteende
· Analysera gruppers och organisationers verksamhet
· Ta hänsyn till attityder och människors tänkande vid planering
· Tillämpa socialpsykologi vid planering av tekniska lösningar
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, students will be able to:
· Explain how people affect other people’s behaviour
· Analyse the functioning of groups and organisations
· Consider attitudes and people's thinking as a part of planning
· Apply social psychology when planning solutions for groups and organizations.

content.fi:
Opintojakson keskeistä sisältöä on sosiaalipsykologian historia sisältäen sosiaalipsykologian sosiaalista kognitiota erittelevät klassiset kokeelliset tutkimukset sekä toisaalta keskeinen konstruktionistisempi teoriapohja sisältäen symbolisen interaktionismin, sosiaaliset representaatiot ja kulttuurihistoriallisen toiminnan teorian.
Lisäksi kurssin aikana opitaan sosiaalipsykologian soveltamisesta teknologiakehitykseen.
content.sv:
Kurssin centralt innehåll omfattar socialpsykologins historia, inklusive klassiska experimentella studier som analyserar social kognition inom socialpsykologin. Å andra sidan inkluderas en centralare konstruktionistisk teoretisk grund, inklusive symbolisk interaktionism, sociala representationer och teori om kulturhistorisk aktivitet.
Dessutom kommer kursen att fokusera på tillämpningen av socialpsykologi på teknologiutveckling.
content.en:
The key content of the course includes the history of social psychology, encompassing classical experimental studies that analyze the social cognition within social psychology. On the other hand, a central and more constructionist theoretical foundation is covered, including symbolic interactionism, social representations, and the theory of cultural-historical activity.
Additionally, during the course, participants will learn about the application of social psychology to technological development.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: BSc-level engineering mathematics; basic programming experience (Python)
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: BSc-level engineering mathematics; basic programming experience (Python)
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: BSc-level engineering mathematics; basic programming experience (Python)

learningOutcomes.fi:
Upon successful completion of this course, the student:
  • Understands and can independently formulate data-analysis requirements associated with different healthcare decision making tasks (risk assessment, early diagnosis, differential diagnosis, treatment planning, and treatment follow-up)
  • Can recognize what kind of approaches (data-driven, rule-based, mechanistic models etc) are most appropriate for what decision-making challenge
  • Has knowledge of, and knows how to select and apply methods for data curation and quality assurance
  • Has an understanding of the most common feature extraction and feature selection methods
  • Has gained knowledge of the most common AI/ML methods for advanced decision support
  • Understands how to objectively assess the performance of AI/ML methods in common healthcare decision support settings
  • Understands considerations such as explainability, privacy-preservation, bias and ethics in computer-based decision support in health and know which tools are available to address these.

learningOutcomes.fi: 1) To understand the fundamentals of research commercialization, with particular focus on Deep Tech; 2) To understand the elements involved in exploring commercial opportunities; 3) To apply these insights and knowledge working with Deep Tech projects or external parties with an interest in exploring the commercial potential of Deep Tech; with the aim of 4) expanding the participant's network of connections.

learningOutcomes.en: 1) To understand the fundamentals of research commercialization, with particular focus on Deep Tech; 2) To understand the elements involved in exploring commercial opportunities; 3) To apply these insights and knowledge working with Deep Tech projects or external parties with an interest in exploring the commercial potential of Deep Tech; with the aim of 4) expanding the participant's network of connections.

content.fi: Exploring the opportunity potential of deep tech can involve: A)Participating in Deep Dive is by individual application as an individual or as part of a pre-formed team. The experience is structured in three phases involving some combination of meetups, group work, independent study, reflective essays, reports and internships. The focus of the first phase is research commercialization fundamentals (1 ECTS) working on a case challenge for external projects. Students invited to participate in the second phase (2 ECTS) will need to deepen their understanding of the domain and the science involved working with the project owner. If a participant is chosen to work with the project directly as an intern, and additional 4 to 7 ECTS are available based on an agreement on scope and deliverables between Teacher in charge and the project owner, AND/OR B) undertaking an independent project whose content, deliverables and scope are agreed in advance with the Teacher in charge. The ECTS limit is 10 and participants must choose one point of exit for credit.

learningOutcomes.fi: This course has been designed to enhance student's understanding of the design infused process expert entrepreneurs rely on to transform ideas into opportunities often in highly ambiguous and uncertain contexts. After this course, students will: a) discover the importance of empathetically framing opportunities, b) hone their ability to apply design thinking principles in practice, c) be able to craft persuasive and engaging messages, and d) practice the art of effectuation/design doing as a basis for driving innovation in their own fields of interest.

content.fi: Expert entrepreneurs: a) spot patterns where others see chaos, b) are grounded in a deep and empathetic understanding of the context within which customers operate and/or solutions sought, c) prototype potential solutions quickly and cheaply to garner feedback, d) openly engage with outside parties to shape the opportunity and share the risk, and e) trust their instincts and intuition in knowing what customers need even if they are unable to articulate it. The group challenge is based on a contemporary issue that is both provocative and open to interpretation.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Any of the following courses (or similar) are useful. Introduction to Materials Science, Materials Physics, Materials Properties, Materials Science and Engineering
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Any of the following courses (or similar) are useful. Introduction to Materials Science, Materials Physics, Materials Properties, Materials Science and Engineering
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Any of the following courses (or similar) are useful. Introduction to Materials Science, Materials Physics, Materials Properties, Materials Science and Engineering

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course:
  • The student masters the basic definitions and terminology relevant for X-ray scattering and can make use of these in real experimental work, for example when estimating optimum experimental conditions for an X-ray scattering experiment.
  • The student can judge which materials properties can be studied using X-ray scattering methods.
  • The student is familiar with the common X-ray scattering methods and can distinguish which X-ray scattering method is appropriate for a specified materials characterization task.
  • The student can plan an X-ray scattering experiment to be carried out together with technical support.
  • The student can carry out X-ray scattering experiments using an X-ray scattering instrument at Aalto.
  • The student can report the results of an X-ray scattering experiment in a scientific article and critically judge the results published by others.
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course:
  • The student masters the basic definitions and terminology relevant for X-ray scattering and can make use of these in real experimental work, for example when estimating optimum experimental conditions for an X-ray scattering experiment.
  • The student can judge which materials properties can be studied using X-ray scattering methods.
  • The student is familiar with the common X-ray scattering methods and can distinguish which X-ray scattering method is appropriate for a specified materials characterization task.
  • The student can plan an X-ray scattering experiment to be carried out together with technical support.
  • The student can carry out X-ray scattering experiments using an X-ray scattering instrument at Aalto.
  • The student can report the results of an X-ray scattering experiment in a scientific article and critically judge the results published by others.

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: CS-A1110 Ohjelmointi 1
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: CS-A1110 Programmering 1
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: CS-A1110 Programming 1

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija on saanut lisää kokemusta ohjelmoinnista ja ongelmanratkaisusta tietokoneiden avulla. Hän osaa kuvata ohjelmoitavan tietokoneen yleisen rakenteen ja rakentamisen logiikkapiirien avulla. Opiskelija osaa määritellä laskentaresursseja (aika, tila, rinnakkaisuus jne.) ja suhteuttaa niitä tietokoneiden fysikaalisiin rajoituksiin ja mahdollisuuksiin. Hän osaa analysoida ja kuvailla ohjelmien toiminnallisuutta, suorituskykyä ja tarvittavien laskentaresurssien rajoja. Opiskelija ymmärtää, kuinka perustietotyypit esitetään tietokoneessa (tavut, kokonaisluvut, liukuluvut, ...). Hän on myös perehtynyt rekursioon sekä funktionaalisen ohjelmoinnin ja rinnakkaislaskennan perusteisiin, ja osaa laatia näitä tekniikoita hyödyntäviä ohjelmia. Opiskelija on tutustunut rajapintojen ja kokoelmatietotyyppien käyttämiseen sekä tuntee ohjelmoinnissa esiintyviä yleisiä haku- ja lajittelutehtäviä. Hän on saanut kokemusta tietokoneohjelmien kuvailemisessa, testaamisessa ja virheiden etsimisestä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avslutad kurs har du fått ytterligare erfarenhet av programmering och förståelse för problemlösning med datorer. Du kommer att kunna beskriva strukturen hos en programmerbar dator och hur den kan byggas upp med hjälp av logiska kretsar. Du kan definiera beräkningsresurser (tid, utrymme, parallellitet, ...) och koppla dessa till datorns fysiska begränsningar och möjligheter. Du kan analysera och förklara funktionaliteten och prestandan hos grundläggande program och uttrycka de beräkningsresurser som behövs i termer av gränsvärden. Du kan förklara hur grundläggande datatyper representeras i en dator (bytes, heltal, flyttal, ...). Du kommer också att ha fått ytterligare kännedom om rekursion, funktionell programmering och grundläggande parallell databehandling. Du kommer att kunna använda dessa tekniker i din egen programmering. Du kan beskriva rollen för gränssnitt och datastrukturer. Du har fått erfarenhet av att felsöka, testa och förklara datorkod. Du är också bekant med grundläggande sök- och sorteringsuppgifter som är vanliga inom programmering.
learningOutcomes.en: After successfully completing the course you have gained further experience in programming and appreciation for problem solving with computers.You will be able to describe the structure of a programmable computer and how it may be built using logic circuits. You can define computational resources (time, space, parallelism, ...) and connect these to the physical limitations and possibilities of the computer. You are able to analyse and explain the functionality and performance of basic programs and express the computational resources needed in terms of bounds. You can explain how basic data types are represented in a computer (bytes, integers, floating point numbers, ...). You will also have gained further familiarity with recursion, functional programming, and basic parallel computing. You will be able to employ these techniques in your own programming. You can describe the role of interfaces and collections. You have gained experience in debugging, testing, and explaining computer code. You are also familiar with basic searching and sorting tasks common in programming.

content.fi: Kokonaislukujen ja liukulukujen binäärimuotoisen esittämisen periaatteet. Bittitason operaatiot. Portit logiikan perusoperaattoreina ja niiden yhdistäminen piirien luomiseksi (esim. yhteenlaskija). Yleinen tietokonearkkitehtuuri porttitasolta korkean tason ohjelmointiin. Yksinkertaisempien funktioiden toteuttaminen assembler-kielellä. Big-O-määritelmä ja laskentaresurssien käsite. Funktionaalisen ohjelmoinnin ja rekursion näkökohdat. Yksinkertaiset rinnakkaisohjelmointikonstruktiot. Itsenäinen ohjelmointi, tietojenkäsittelytieteen tuntemus ja ongelmanratkaisu tietokoneiden avulla.
content.sv: Principer för binär representation av heltal och flyttal. Operationer på bitnivå. Grindar som grundläggande logiska operatorer och hur dessa kan kombineras för att skapa kretsar (t.ex. för en adderare). Allmän datorarkitektur från grindnivå till högnivåprogrammering. Implementering av enklare funktioner i assembler. Ordo-definitionen och begreppet beräkningsresurser. Aspekter av funktionell programmering och rekursion. Enkla parallella programmeringskonstruktioner. Självständig programmering, kunskaper i datavetenskap och problemlösning med datorer.
content.en: Principles of binary representation of integers and floating point numbers. Bit-level operations. Gates as basic logic operators and how these can be combined to create circuits (e.g. for an adder). General computer architecture from gate level to high-level programming. Implementation of simpler functions in assembly language. The big-O definition, and concept of computational resources. Aspects of functional programming and recursion. Simple parallel programming constructs. Independent programming, knowledge of computer science, and problem-solving with computers.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija: Ymmärtää organisaation johtamisen keskeiset tehtävät ja funktiot, teoreettiset peruskäsitteet ja historiallisen kehityksen.
  1. Tunnistaa kuinka johtaminen edistää organisaation tavoitteiden saavuttamista ja perustehtävän toteuttamista erilaisissa ympäristöissä eettisesti ja kestävästi.
  2. Ymmärtää inhimillisen motivaation perusteet, vaikuttamis- ja yhteistyösuhteiden rakentumisen dynamiikan ja johtamistyöhön liittyvät eettiset periaatteet.
  3. On vahvistanut henkilökohtaista vaikuttamiskykyään ja kehittänyt valmiuksia oman johtajuuden kehittymiseen ja jatkuvaan oppimiseen.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen kan studenten:
  1. Förstå de centrala uppgifterna och funktioner, teoretiska grundbegreppen och den historiska utvecklingen av organisatoriskt ledarskap.
  2. Identifiera hur ledarskap främjar uppnåendet av organisationens mål och utförandet av kärnuppdraget i olika miljöer på ett etiskt och hållbart sätt.
  3. Förstå grunderna för mänsklig motivation, dynamiken i att bygga inflytande och samarbetsrelationer samt de etiska principerna som är relaterade till ledarskap.
  4. Ha stärkat sin personliga påverkanskraft och byggt upp förmågan att utveckla sitt eget ledarskap och lärande på kontinuerligt sätt.
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course, the student will:
  1. Understand the key tasks, theoretical concepts, and historical development of organizational leadership.
  2. Identify how leadership promotes the achievement of organizational goals and the fulfillment of the core mission in various environments in an ethical and sustainble way.
  3. Comprehend the basics of human motivation, the dynamics of building influence and collaboration relationships, and the ethical principles related to leadership.
  4. Have strengthened his/her personal influence skills and developed readiness for the evolution of his/her own leadership and continuous learning

content.fi: Kurssi antaa opiskelijoille hyvän perusymmärryksen johtamisen merkityksestä, johtajuuden rakentumisesta yksilöä laajempana ilmiönä ja johtamistehtävistä nykyaikaisissa organisaatioissa. Kurssi tarjoaa käytännöllisen, toiminnallisen ja eettisen näkökulman johtamisen olennaisiin teorioihin, käsitteisiin, ja käytäntöihin. Opiskelija ymmärtää kurssin jälkeen, miten johtamisen käytännöt edistävät organisaation tavoitteiden saavuttamista ja tarkoituksen toteutumista. Kurssin myötä opiskelijat ovat perehtyneet motivaation perusteisiin, ymmärtävät miten kestävät vaikuttamis- ja yhteistyösuhteet rakentuvat organisaatiossa, sekä miten johtajuus vaikuttaa organisaation kulttuuriin ja työn tekemisen edellytyksiin. Kurssin aikana opiskelijat syventävät aktiivisesti omaa johtamisajatteluansa ja luovat perustan johtamistaitojen oppimiseen ja jalostamiseen insinöörityön ja muiden asiantuntijatehtävien kontekstissa. Kurssi luo perustan johtamisen ja organisoitumisen syventävien kurssien suorittamiselle ja jatkuvalle oppimiselle.
content.sv: Kursen ger studenterna en bra grundläggande förståelse för ledarskapets betydelse, bildandet av ledarskap som ett fenomen som sträcker sig bortom individen, och ledningsuppgifterna i moderna organisationer. Kursen erbjuder en praktisk, funktionell och etisk synvinkel på grundläggande teorier, begrepp och praxis inom ledarskap. Efter avslutad kurs kommer studenterna att förstå hur ledarskapspraxis främjar att uppnå organisationens mål och förverkligandet av dess syfte. Genom kursen blir studenterna bekanta med motivationens grundläggande principer, förstår hur hållbara påverkans- och samarbetsrelationer byggs inom en organisation, samt hur ledarskap påverkar organisationens kultur och arbetsförutsättningar. Under kursen fördjupar studenterna aktivt sitt eget ledarstänkande och lägger grunden för lärande och förfining av ledarskapsfärdigheter inom ramen för ingenjörsarbete och andra expertuppdrag. Kursen skapar en grund för att genomföra avancerade kurser inom ledarskap och organisation samt stödjer kontinuerligt lärande.
content.en: The course provides students with a solid foundational understanding of the significance of leadership, the construction of leadership as a phenomenon beyond the individual, and the tasks of leadership in modern organizations. The course offers a practical, functional, and ethical perspective on the essential theories, concepts, and practices of leadership. After completing the course, students will understand how leadership practices promote the achievement of organizational goals and the realization of purpose. Through the course, students become familiar with the basics of motivation, comprehend how sustainable influence and collaboration relationships are built within an organization, and understand how leadership influences organizational culture and the conditions for work. Throughout the course, students actively deepen their own leadership thinking, laying the groundwork for learning and refining leadership skills in the context of engineering work and other expert tasks. The course establishes a foundation for undertaking advanced leadership courses, and for continuous learning and personal development.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing this course, the student is able to
  • Model classical one-dimensional conductors using voltage and current fields
  • Apply the theoretical framework of quantum mechanics in electric
    circuits and devices, that is, circuit quantum electrodynamics
  • Design and model superconducting quantum circuits: from resonators to qubits
  • Identity electrical circuits of practical interest that behave quantum mechanically
  • Distinguish between linear and non linear electronic systems and utilize them for the desired functionalities, for example
  • Hypothesize on the behavior of quantum systems

content.fi:
The physical foundations and implementation of solid-state quantum electronics has attracted broad interest in the context of the realization of quantum information processing systems. In this course, we address the physics of superconducting quantum circuits and show how such circuits can be implemented based on superconducting thin films and nanostructures. We discuss the application of superconducting quantum circuits in quantum information processing systems and in quantum simulation. The following specific topics will be addressed:
  • Josephson effect and Jospehson junction as a circuit element
  • systematic quantization of a network of lumped-element electric components such as capacitors, inductors, and Josephson junctions
  • classical description of electromagnetics in one-dimension: voltage and current fields
  • quantum mechanics of one-dimensional transmission lines and resonators
  • cavity-qubit systems and the Jaynes Cummings model
  • operation of superconducting qubits: reset, quantum logic, and readout.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The students will during the course learn to 1)    Understand, apply, 
analyze, evaluate, and create a strategy based on generative AI 
understanding its role in shaping business models and competitive 
advantages across various industries. 2)     Apply generative AI tools 
and techniques in strategy creation including analyzing trends, creating
 scenarios, analyzing internal capabilities, assessing market 
opportunities and ‘right to win’, and creating an execution roadmap.

content.fi:
This course provides students with the skills necessary to develop and 
implement strategies based on generative AI technologies, such as large 
language models. It explores how generative AI shapes technology, 
workflows, and business models across various industries, and how it can
 be integrated into the strategic planning of a firm. Students will 
learn how strategies based on generative AI can fundamentally alter 
business operations and value creation and also about the societal and 
geopolitical impacts of generative AI, emphasizing its role in both 
business performance and broader societal contexts. Furthermore, 
students will learn how to use generative AI tools such as ChatGPT to 
create strategies.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student is able to
  1. Understand the dynamics and requirements of different organizational renewal and development conditions.
  2. Analyze developmental and renewal needs of an organization using various methods.
  3. Identify leadership needs of different organizational renewal and development processes.
  4. Plan and design participatory organizational development and renewal processes.
  5. Apply participatory approaches and methods to support organizational change and development.

  5. Apply participatory approaches and methods to support organizational change and development.

content.fi: Successfully leading organizational renewal and change processes is a core competence for both managers and consultants. In the course the students will build deep understanding on how to design effective participatory renewal processes for organizations, how to lead such processes and what they require from leadership. The course will familiarize the students with various organizational renewal conditions and their dynamics. The students will learn how to use various approaches to analyze organizational renewal and development needs. In the course the students will get a real-life experience on organizational analysis, designing of participatory transformation process, and demonstration of the proposal to the client organization. The students will work in groups with a specific client case to apply the content, methods, and concepts introduced in the course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Through completing the course, the participants will:
  • understand the principles of value creation in service systems;
  • comprehend the factors affecting the productivity and sustainability of service operations;
  • understand how service providers design services and service experiences, and integrate resources in the innovation for new service solutions;
  • identify the contemporary developments in networked, value-focused, and platform-enabled service operations;
  • be familiar with the theoretical perspectives relevant to the transformation of technology businesses toward service-based value creation.

content.fi: The course focuses on the analysis and design of services and service systems from the perspectives of the productivity and sustainability of service-based operations. The course covers the fundamental principles of the service economy, multi-actor value creation in service operations, innovation for new service concepts in complex service systems, modularity of service solutions, business models in service ecosystems, and institutional change towards sustainable service-based value creation.

content.en: The course focuses on the analysis and design of services and service systems from the perspectives of the productivity and sustainability of service-based operations. The course covers the fundamental principles of the service economy, multi-actor value creation in service operations, innovation for new service concepts in complex service systems, modularity of service solutions, business models in service ecosystems, and institutional change towards sustainable service-based value creation.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: TU-E2211 Financial Risk Management 1 or Basic course in Finance, Basic course in Python

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course complements the content of TU-E2211 Financial Risk Management with Derivatives 1. After the 3 cr. version of the course, the student is able to apply the most common machine learning methods to financial problems and to test the accuracy of the analysis. In addition, the student knows how to prepare financial data for analysis and how to avoid the typical problems related to machine learning in finance.
Additionally, after the 5 cr. course, the student is able to design and complete a small project in machine learning with financial data.

learningOutcomes.fi:
This course complements the content of TU-E2211 Financial Risk Management with Derivatives 1. After the 3 cr. version of the course, the student understands how options and other derivatives are used in risk management and knows their practical limitations; is familiar with foreign exchange products and fixed income products, understands different interest rate models and volatility models; has a routine to solve simple problems in Ito calculus.
Additionally, after the 5 cr. version of the course, the student knows the most important value adjustments, how to compute them, and how to calibrate a yield curve.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Mandatory: MS-A0111 Differential and integral calculus 1 (SCI), MS-A0211 Differential and integral calculus 2 (SCI), MS-A0001 Matrix algebra (SCI) Recommended: MS-A0503 First course in probability and statistics
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Mandatory: MS-A0111 Differential and integral calculus 1 (SCI), MS-A0211 Differential and integral calculus 2 (SCI), MS-A0001 Matrix algebra (SCI) Recommended: MS-A0503 First course in probability and statistics
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Mandatory: MS-A0111 Differential and integral calculus 1 (SCI), MS-A0211 Differential and integral calculus 2 (SCI), MS-A0001 Matrix algebra (SCI) Recommended: MS-A0503 First course in probability and statistics

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the 3 cr. version of the course, the student
  • understands the purpose, basic properties, and use of derivatives for financial risk managment,
  • knows the mathematical theory of options and other derivatives, 
  • is familiar with how models are implemented, how they are used in practice, and what the strengths and weaknesses of different models are.
  • knows how to use tools from engineering mathematics and physics in financial risk management and finance, and what are their limitations.
Additionally, after the 5 cr. version of the course, the student knows how to apply engineering mathematics and computational methods to the analysis of financal market data.

learningOutcomes.fi:
The student has a good understanding of the key concepts and methods of investment science, including topics such as interests rates; cash flow analysis; Markowitz' portfolio theory; capital asset pricing model; arbitrage pricing theory; forward, futures and option contracts; pricing of options; hedging; interest rate derivatives; interest rate dynamics. 
The student is able to formulate and solve problems involving financial instruments. The student has a strong foundation for pursuing advanced studies in financial engineering and quantitative finance.

organizationName.en: Department of Mathematics and Systems Analysis

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: MS-A05XX Todennäköisyyslaskennan ja tilastotieteen peruskurssi
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: MS-A05XX Grundkurs i sannolikhetskalkyl och statistik
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: MS-A05XX First course in probability and statistics

learningOutcomes.fi: Opiskelija hallitsee riskianalyysin keskeiset käsitteet ja menetelmät sekä osaa soveltaa niitä teknisten järjestelmiä koskevissa tarkasteluissa.
learningOutcomes.sv: Studenten känner till de centrala begreppen och metoderna för riskanalys och kan tilllämpa dem för att undersöka tekniska system.
learningOutcomes.en: The student knows the central concepts and methods of risk analysis and is able to apply them to the study of engineering systems.

content.fi: Kurssi perehdyttää riskinalyysin keskeisimpiin menetelmiin ja antaa valmiudet soveltaa niitä erilaisten teknis-taloudellisten järjestelmien riskitarkasteluissa (ml. riskien tunnistaminen ja arviointi, riskienhallintatoimenpiteiden vertailu ja priorisointi, riskiviestintä). Käsiteltäviä menetelmiä ovat muun muassa vikapuut, syy-seuraus-kaaviot sekä todennäköisyyspohjainen turvallisuusanalyysi. Kurssilla perehdytään myös todennäköisyyksien estimointiin sekä asiantuntija-arvioiden että tilastollisten menetelmien pohjalta. Luennot ja laskuharjoitukset sisältävät riskianalyysien laatimista ja käyttöä havainnollistavia esimerkkejä.
content.sv: Kursen introducerar de viktigaste metoderna för riskanalys och ger färdigheter i att tillämpa dem vid riskbedömning av olika tekniska och ekonomiska system (inkl. riskidentifiering och riskbedömning, utvärdering och prioritering av riskhanteringsåtgärder, riskkommunikation). Bland de metoder som behandlas ingår felträd, orsak-verkan-diagram och probabilistisk säkerhetsanalys. Kursen behandlar även uppskattning av sannolikheter med hjälp av både expertbedömningar och statistiska metoder. Föreläsningar och beräkningsövningar inkluderar exempel som illustrerar utvecklingen och användningen av riskanalyser.
content.en: The course covers the main methods of risk analysis and their applications in risk assessment of various techno-economic systems (including risk identification and assessment, comparison and prioritisation of risk management measures, risk communication). Methods to be considered include fault trees, cause and effect diagrams and probabilistic safety analysis. The course will also cover probability estimation based on both expert judgement and statistical methods. Lectures and computational exercises will include examples illustrating the development and use of risk analyses.

learningOutcomes.sv: Studenten känner till de centrala begreppen och metoderna för riskanalys och kan tilllämpa dem för att undersöka tekniska system.
learningOutcomes.en: The student knows the central concepts and methods of risk analysis and is able to apply them to the study of engineering systems.

content.fi: Kurssi perehdyttää riskinalyysin keskeisimpiin menetelmiin ja antaa valmiudet soveltaa niitä erilaisten teknis-taloudellisten järjestelmien riskitarkasteluissa (ml. riskien tunnistaminen ja arviointi, riskienhallintatoimenpiteiden vertailu ja priorisointi, riskiviestintä). Käsiteltäviä menetelmiä ovat muun muassa vikapuut, syy-seuraus-kaaviot sekä todennäköisyyspohjainen turvallisuusanalyysi. Kurssilla perehdytään myös todennäköisyyksien estimointiin sekä asiantuntija-arvioiden että tilastollisten menetelmien pohjalta. Luennot ja laskuharjoitukset sisältävät riskianalyysien laatimista ja käyttöä havainnollistavia esimerkkejä.
content.sv: Kursen introducerar de viktigaste metoderna för riskanalys och ger färdigheter i att tillämpa dem vid riskbedömning av olika tekniska och ekonomiska system (inkl. riskidentifiering och riskbedömning, utvärdering och prioritering av riskhanteringsåtgärder, riskkommunikation). Bland de metoder som behandlas ingår felträd, orsak-verkan-diagram och probabilistisk säkerhetsanalys. Kursen behandlar även uppskattning av sannolikheter med hjälp av både expertbedömningar och statistiska metoder. Föreläsningar och beräkningsövningar inkluderar exempel som illustrerar utvecklingen och användningen av riskanalyser.
content.en: The course covers the main methods of risk analysis and their applications in risk assessment of various techno-economic systems (including risk identification and assessment, comparison and prioritisation of risk management measures, risk communication). Methods to be considered include fault trees, cause and effect diagrams and probabilistic safety analysis. The course will also cover probability estimation based on both expert judgement and statistical methods. Lectures and computational exercises will include examples illustrating the development and use of risk analyses.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing this course the student 
1. can formulate a wide variety of optimization problems, which solutions can be used for making better decisions (e.g. allocating resources, selecting routes and assigning tasks), as (mixed integer) linear programming problems, 
2. understands the theoretical foundation of the Simplex algorithm and duality, and knows the special characteristics of network and integer programming problems, and 
3. can solve (mixed integer) linear programming problems using optimization software.

content.fi: The simplex method and variants, duality for linear programming, interior point method, and introduction to integer programming. Applications to transportation, process industry, production planning, network design and others.

learningOutcomes.fi:
1. Understand how several important problems arising from diverse fields can be cast and solved as nonlinear optimisation problems;
  2. Know the main techniques for solving nonlinear optimisation problems and how to apply them in practice;
  3. Know how to use optimisation software for implementing and solving nonlinear optimisation problems.

content.fi: In this course, the student will learn the basic optimisation theory behind the main numerical algorithms available and how they can be applied to solve optimisation problems. At the end of the course, it is expected that the student will be capable of analysing the main characteristics of an optimisation problem and decide what is the most suitable method to be employed for its solution.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After completing this course, the student 
1. knows the key concepts in decision analysis, 
2. can structure and model problems with multiple attributes, decision dynamics and uncertainty for aiding decision-making, 
3. understands the assumptions underlying decision analytic models and why the behaviour of real decision-makers may differ from the behaviour that these models would predict, and 
4. knows how to use optimization methods in conjunction with decision analysis.

content.fi: Optimization methods for dynamic systems: dynamic programming, calculus of variations, maximum principle, numerical solution methods, stochastic dynamic optimization. Application examples on engineering, economics and biology.
content.sv: Optimization methods for dynamic systems: dynamic programming, calculus of variations, maximum principle, numerical solution methods, stochastic dynamic optimization. Application examples on engineering, economics and biology.
content.en: Optimization methods for dynamic systems: dynamic programming, calculus of variations, maximum principle, numerical solution methods, stochastic dynamic optimization. Application examples on engineering, economics and biology.
